tiles.name: aegis_7_surface_crust
tiles.description: The outer layer of Aegis-7, scarred by eons of cosmic radiation and micrometeoroid impacts. Mineral composition indicates potential energy sources below.

tiles.name: irradiated_regolith_field
tiles.description: A vast expanse of loose rock and dust on Aegis-7's surface, heavily bombarded by solar radiation. Few organisms can survive here.

tiles.name: the_cradle_fissure_entrance
tiles.description: A narrow opening leading down into 'The Cradle', a water-filled fissure where life originated on Aegis-7. Bioluminescent bacteria are visible near the entrance.

tiles.name: mineral_rich_vein_outcrop
tiles.description: A prominent vein of rare minerals exposed on the asteroid's surface. A potential source of energy for chemoautotrophic organisms like Axion.

tiles.name: shadowed_crater_basin
tiles.description: A deep crater shielded from direct sunlight, offering a slightly more protected environment on Aegis-7's surface.

tiles.name: biofilm_covered_rockface
tiles.description: A section of Aegis-7's surface coated in a thin layer of biofilm, evidence of microbial colonization.

tiles.name: the_great_divide_ridge
tiles.description: A prominent ridge running along Aegis-7, splitting the asteroid into two distinct regions. The southern side is more irradiated.

tiles.name: subsurface_ice_pocket
tiles.description: A small pocket of frozen water located beneath the surface, a vital resource for life on Aegis-7.

tiles.name: microbial_garden_patch
tiles.description: A concentrated area of microbial growth on Aegis-7's surface, forming a complex ecosystem.

tiles.name: equatorial_radiation_belt
tiles.description: The most heavily irradiated region of Aegis-7, located along its equator. Few organisms can survive unprotected here.

tiles.name: southern_mineral_deposit
tiles.description: A rich deposit of rare minerals on the southern hemisphere of Aegis-7, accessible via several small fissures.

tiles.name: northern_ice_field
tiles.description: A larger field of ice near the northern pole, possibly connected to the subsurface ice pocket.

tiles.name: the_cradle_interior_zone_1
tiles.description: The upper regions of the Cradle fissure, closest to the surface. Exhibits higher radiation levels and less stable conditions.

tiles.name: the_cradle_central_pool
tiles.description: The central water pool in the Cradle, teeming with microbial life and bioluminescent bacteria. Axion resides here.

tiles.name: the_cradle_fissure_wall_west
tiles.description: The western wall of the Cradle, rich in mineral deposits that Axion helps to process.

tiles.name: the_cradle_fissure_wall_east
tiles.description: The eastern wall of the Cradle, known for its unique bioluminescent bacteria strains.

tiles.name: hydrothermal_vent_alpha
tiles.description: A small hydrothermal vent within the Cradle, releasing heat and chemicals into the water pool.

tiles.name: the_cradle_lower_chamber
tiles.description: A deeper chamber within the Cradle, with slightly different mineral composition and microbial lifeforms.

tiles.name: stable_water_pocket
tiles.description: A stable region of water in the Cradle, crucial for sustaining life, despite outer forces.

tiles.name: mineral_flow_delta
tiles.description: Where a mineral-rich flow from the surface meets the water of the cradle.

tiles.name: the_void_gulf
tiles.description: Vast emptiness of space, a pathway to the other planets.

tiles.name: the_astral_scar
tiles.description: Cosmic trails of asteroids that have passed Aegis-7.

tiles.name: aegis_7_gravitational_field_edge
tiles.description: The point at which Aegis-7's gravity loses strength.

tiles.name: the_sun_facing_surface
tiles.description: The scorching surface of Aegis-7, directly exposed to sun's radiation.

tiles.name: hidden_rock_crevice
tiles.description: A small, rock enclosed crevice that can be used to gain vantage on Aegis-7.

tiles.name: chemical_trail
tiles.description: A trial leading away from Aegis-7, likely left by an organism.

tiles.name: mineral_enriched_ice_patch
tiles.description: Ice patch that has captured some minerals.

tiles.name: aegis_7_rock_core
tiles.description: The inner rock of Aegis-7's core.

tiles.name: aegis_7_shadowed_surface
tiles.description: The shadowed side of Aegis-7. Safe from the harsh rays of the sun.

tiles.name: empty_air_pocket
tiles.description: An empty air pocket within Aegis-7.

tiles.name: the_irradiated_cove
tiles.description: Cove with high radiation levels.

tiles.name: chemical_signal_trace
tiles.description: Trace of chemical signals.

tiles.name: biofilm_dense_patch
tiles.description: A dense biofilm location.

tiles.name: the_mineral_garden
tiles.description: Where mineral's grow within Aegis-7.

tiles.name: the_bio_luminescent_river
tiles.description: A river of bioluminescence.

tiles.name: aegis_7_cold_north_end
tiles.description: The coldest end of the planet.

tiles.name: chemical_signal_intersection
tiles.description: The main chemical signal intersection point.

tiles.name: the_cradle_mineral_heart
tiles.description: The core of the planet is filled with minerals.

tiles.name: solar_flare_hotspot
tiles.description: Where solar flares have left there mark.

tiles.name: microbial_nest_zone
tiles.description: Area where many microbial's live in close vicinity.

tiles.name: asteroid_belt_passage
tiles.description: Direct path through the asteroid belt.

tiles.description: The southern most tip of Aegis-7.

tiles.description: The planets coldest spring.

tiles.description: Very hot location on Aegis-7.

tiles.name: the_bioluminescent_forest

tiles.name: aegis_7_surface_lake
tiles.description: Main lake on Aegis-7.

tiles.name: the_great_ravine

tiles.name: radioactive_wasteland
